topic.title: Note testing
topic.shortdesc: A <note> element contains information, differentiated from the main text, which expands on or calls attention to a particular point.

section.title: Note
section.note: Defines the type of a note. For example, if the note is a tip, the word Tip is used to draw the reader’s attention to it. Note that this differs from the type attribute on many other DITA elements. See “The type attribute” on page 480 for detailed information on supported values and processing implications.

section.title: Tip
section.note: Defines the type of a note. For example, if the note is a tip, the word Tip is used to draw the reader’s attention to it. Note that this differs from the type attribute on many other DITA elements. See “The type attribute” on page 480 for detailed information on supported values and processing implications.

section.note: Defines the type of a note. For example, if the note is a tip, the word Tip is used to draw the reader’s attention to it. Note that this differs from the type attribute on many other DITA elements. See “The type attribute” on page 480 for detailed information on supported values and processing implications.

section.title: restriction

Note that this differs from the type attribute on many other DITA elements. See “The type attribute” on page 480 for detailed information on supported values and processing implications.

section.title: important

Note that this differs from the type attribute on many other DITA elements. See “The type attribute” on page 480 for detailed information on supported values and processing implications.
